Title: Senior Remote Sensing Analyst - Fredericton, NB - Indeed.com
Description:
Remote Sensing Analyst
Reporting Relationship: Geospatial Processing & Solutions Manager
Overall Position Mandate: To significantly contribute to the ongoing success of Leading Edge Geomatics (LEG) by processing complete and accurate LiDAR aerial survey data using company workflow processes to ensure the highest levels of accuracy, data quality and client satisfaction.
Key Position Objectives:
Data Organization and Management
Assisting with cataloguing and organizing all data (survey control, aerial, photography, LIDAR, etc.) ensuring data is labelled intelligently and consistently, so that team members can find data when needed
Trajectory Processing and Quality Control
Follow and contribute to LEG best practices processes and workflows to ensure the highest levels of data integrity, accuracy and quality are maintained
Accurately processing trajectories using GPS base stations, PP-RTX or other corrections methods to produce the smoothed best estimate to trajectory and relate it to specific sensors
Precisely relating the trajectory to the photo centres
Using correct sensor parameters, interior and exterior orientations, strip assignment, image preparations and ground control points to create a comprehensive aerial triangulation project and any reporting required
Data Preparation
Maintain well-organized and standard format data sets to be easily ingested by the workflows currently in place. This will be achieved by:
Providing data in the proper directory structure and projection
Providing data that had been checked and is as free of errors as possible
Providing all required metadata and associated reporting files
LiDAR Processing
The overall goal is to deliver LiDAR survey data of the highest possible quality and accuracy; meeting all project specifications within the timelines required and meeting or exceeding client expectations at all times.
This will be achieved by:
Carefully reviewing the collected LiDAR point clouds to ensure data is coherent, has complete coverage, and does not contain anomalies resulting from sensor errors or mission planning.
Generating thorough and complete georeferenced LAS files using the correct software settings for the sensor and navigation information within the timelines required.
Carefully confirming that the sensor boresight is correct and that the LiDAR strips are vertically consistent with each other and within the system specifications.
Efficiently using the appropriate software filters to automatically tile and classify information within the point cloud to specified layers.
Thoroughly and accurately packaging LIDAR data for shipping to subcontractors and further for final deliverables within the timelines and to spec required.
Contribute to develop scripts and methods to achieve various manipulations of data to create unique outputs for clients
Quality Control
Consistently following LEG “best practices” processes and workflows to ensure the highest levels of data integrity, accuracy and quality, with QC processes and targets varying for different datasets.
Carefully reviewing LIDAR to ensure that all anomalies resulting from the processing workflow (in house or introduced by subcontractors) are removed and tiles are ready for delivery
Conducting a final quality check using the National Standards for Spatial Data Accuracy (NSSDA) using a combination of ground control points, and stereo compiled points to report the LiDAR accuracy.
Aerial Photography Processing
Additional duties may include Aerial Photography Processing as required:
Thoroughly processing images using image development software and reviewing to assess their quality, coverage and suitability for project requirements.
Following company best practices to run aerial triangulations, assessing the aerial triangulation report, identifying any blunders, systematic errors or other anomalies.
Extracting an automated point matching digital terrain model (DTM) using company best practices for spacing and filtering of points
Conducting a final quality check using the National Standards for Spatial Data Accuracy (NSSDA) using a combination of ground control points, and stereo compiled points to report the image accuracy.
Carefully packaging all project deliverables, checking to confirm that all project requirements have been met.
Additional Duties:
Assist with development of new products
Source and maintain open access spatial data for use during data preparation and LiDAR processing.
Qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to achieve each of the key objectives previously outlined. The requirements that follow are representative of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required to achieve these objectives.
Education and Experience
Must have successfully completed a post-secondary training program in remote sensing and/or GIS (including mapping, projections and datum) from a recognized post-secondary institution. Strong computer skills are also required.
Three years experience is required.
Additional notes include:
Complete tasks with minimal intervention
Be a self starter
Responsible for assisting Project Coordinators with delivery QC and preparations when required
Assist in training and mentoring less experienced staff members
Occasionally lead teams when required
Professionalism
Possesses a strong work ethic, is dependable and responsible, with the ability to be prompt and on time on a consistent basis.
Committed to continuous professional development and learning, taking the initiative to attend training when permitted and upgrade personal knowledge and skills.
Positive and constructive team player, willingly assisting fellow team members and sharing knowledge.
Contributes to team spirit and acts as a motivator to others, sharing information in a cooperative and timely manner with others to achieve Leading Edge Geomatics’ overall business objectives.
Demonstrates a helpful and positive approach to all business dealings with clients and colleagues and strives for a win-win situation at all times.
Ability to remain calm under pressure; deals well with stress.

Work personas are categories that are assigned to employees depending on the nature of their work. Employees will fall into one of three categories: Remote, Flexible or Required in Office.
